subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: The advanced API example demonstrates the use of the SchemaCrawler API to create a data source, and obtain database metadata. The SchemaCrawler API is a much simpler alternative to using JDBC metadata.

ol.li: Try modifying the schemacrawler.config.properties with regular expressions, logging, and so on.
Try using different SchemaCrawler commands in the Maven test project's pom.xml file. (For a complete list of SchemaCrawler commands, run java -jar <schemacrawler-jar>.)
Try defining a new database connection, using your favorite database and driver.
Try modifying the APIExample class, to explore all of the database metadata that is available via the SchemaCrawler API.
